text: The 2019–20 Iraq FA Cup was the 31st edition of the Iraqi knockout football cup competition, the main domestic cup in Iraqi football, featuring a total of 20 teams from the Iraqi Premier League and 48 teams from the Iraq Division One and Iraq Division Two. The tournament started on 12 September 2019, but was abandoned during the Round of 32 because of the COVID-19 pandemic.https://www.rudaw.net/arabic/sports/260720193 == Format == === Participation === The cup started with the first round, consisting of 48 teams from the Iraq Division One and Iraq Division Two, followed by the second round, consisting of the 24 qualified teams. The 20 Iraqi Premier League clubs joined the 12 qualified teams to form the Round of 32. === Cards === If a player received a second yellow card, they were banned from the next cup match. If a player received a red card, they were banned for a minimum of one match, but more could be added by the Iraq Football Association. == Participating clubs == The following 68 teams were participating in the competition: {| class="wikitable" style="width:96%;" |- style="vertical- align:top; background:#53FF53; text-align:center;" | style="width:32%;" | Iraqi Premier League 20 clubs from the 2019–20 season | style="width:32%;" | Iraq Division One / Iraq Division Two 48 clubs from the 2019–20 season |- style="vertical-align:top;" | * Al- Diwaniya * Al-Hudood * Al-Kahrabaa * Al-Karkh * Al-Minaa * Al-Naft * Al-Najaf * Al-Qasim * Al-Quwa Al-Jawiya * Al-Samawa * Al-Shorta * Al-Sinaat Al- Kahrabaiya * Al-Talaba * Al-Zawraa * Amanat Baghdad * Erbil * Naft Al-Junoob * Naft Al-Wasat * Naft Maysan * Zakho | * Al-Alam * Al-Amir * Al-Baladi * Al- Hakim * Al-Hamza * Al-Hawija * Al-Hurr * Al-Husseiniya * Al-Kadhimiya * Al- Kifl * Al-Kufa * Al-Kut * Al-Mahmoudiya * Al-Maqal * Al-Mosul * Al-Muroor * Al-Najma * Al-Nasr Wal-Salam * Al-Noor * Al-Raudhatain * Al-Sadeq * Al-Saha Wal-Bia * Al-Shabab * Al-Sufiya * Al-Tijara * Al-Taji * Al-Tuz * Ana * Babil * Balad * Baladiyat Al-Basra * Baladiyat Al-Nasiriya * Bani Saad * Baquba * Beladi * Bismaya * Diyala * Haifa * Hibhib * Jalawla * Jisr Diyala * Junoob Baghdad * Medinat Al-Shuhadaa * Masafi Al-Wasat * Shabab Al-Iraq * Shahraban * Suq Al-Shuyukh * Taza |} *Bold: indicated teams are still in competition == Schedule == The rounds of the 2019–20 competition were scheduled as follows: {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! Round ! Draw date ! colspan="2"|Match dates |- |First round |rowspan="2"|25 August 2019 |colspan="2"|12–13 September 2019 |- |Second round |colspan="2"|17–20 September 2019 |- |Round of 32 |rowspan="5"|30 September 2019 |colspan="2"|9 October 2019 – N/A |- |Round of 16 |rowspan="4" colspan="2"|N/A |- |Quarter- finals |- |Semi-finals |- |Final |} == First round == 48 teams from the Division One and Division Two competed in this round. == Second round == == Final phase == === Bracket === == Round of 32 == 20 top-tier teams and 12 lower-tier teams were set to compete in this round. == References == ==External links== *Iraqi Football Website *Iraqi FA Cup 2019/2020, Goalzz.com Category:Iraq FA Cup Iraq Cup Iraq FA Cup
title: 2019–20 Iraq FA Cup
